snippet: Driven from a remote area by fighting and the threat of famine, thousands of children are repeating the perilous flight of the so-called Lost Boys during Sudan’s 1990s civil war.
abstract: Thousands of unaccompanied children are streaming out of Sudan's war-torn Nuba Mountain region, fleeing a relentless aerial assault and the prospect of famine; journey, which traverses battlefields and malarial swamps, is a grim repetition of the so-called Lost Boys migration during the country's civil war in the 1990s.
lead_paragraph: Driven from a remote area by fighting and the threat of famine, thousands of children are repeating the perilous flight of the so-called Lost Boys during Sudan’s 1990s civil war.
